trans-unit.source: Understanding the Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Understanding the Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: You can use the Azure management portal to create, edit, and monitor <token>sb1</token> messaging entities.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Azure management portal to create, edit, and monitor <token>sb1</token> messaging entities.

trans-unit.source: You can also perform many of the operations and functionality the portal provides programmatically, using the <externalLink><linkText>Service Bus .NET managed API</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj659880.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>, or the <link xlink:href="19846669-ed17-4999-bdc8-79f99022a6ff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Service Bus REST API Reference</link>.
trans-unit.target: You can also perform many of the operations and functionality the portal provides programmatically, using the <externalLink><linkText>Service Bus .NET managed API</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj659880.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>, or the <link xlink:href="19846669-ed17-4999-bdc8-79f99022a6ff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Service Bus REST API Reference</link>.

trans-unit.source: Accessing the Azure management portal
trans-unit.target: Accessing the Azure management portal

trans-unit.source: You can access the Azure management portal <externalLink><linkText>here</linkText><linkUri>http://manage.windowsazure.com</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: You can access the Azure management portal <externalLink><linkText>here</linkText><linkUri>http://manage.windowsazure.com</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: To create your account and obtain or manage the necessary tokens, projects, and namespaces, you must have a Microsoft Account (MSA).
trans-unit.target: To create your account and obtain or manage the necessary tokens, projects, and namespaces, you must have a Microsoft Account (MSA).

trans-unit.source: Choosing Namespaces
trans-unit.target: Choosing Namespaces

trans-unit.source: After logging in to the portal, you can create <token>servicensd</token>s.
trans-unit.target: After logging in to the portal, you can create <token>servicensd</token>s.

trans-unit.source: Namespaces are scoping mechanisms, just as they are in .NET programming or in XML.
trans-unit.target: Namespaces are scoping mechanisms, just as they are in .NET programming or in XML.

trans-unit.source: The <token>servicensd</token>s you create must be unique across all <token>sb2</token> accounts; when you create a namespace in an <token>azure_2</token> project, you are declaring a base or root namespace that is owned and secured by you.
trans-unit.target: The <token>servicensd</token>s you create must be unique across all <token>sb2</token> accounts; when you create a namespace in an <token>azure_2</token> project, you are declaring a base or root namespace that is owned and secured by you.

trans-unit.source: That root namespace is the namespace that is used to manage Shared Access Signature (SAS) security tokens, and it is a namespace under which you can register any number of services related to your work.
trans-unit.target: That root namespace is the namespace that is used to manage Shared Access Signature (SAS) security tokens, and it is a namespace under which you can register any number of services related to your work.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can declare multiple namespaces in a project; each one is completely isolated from the others for all work that you may do.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can declare multiple namespaces in a project; each one is completely isolated from the others for all work that you may do.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you use the portal to declare a namespace called <codeInline>contoso-samples</codeInline>, <token>sb2</token> creates the resources that you need in order to host, secure, and bill for services underneath the complete namespace URI.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you use the portal to declare a namespace called <codeInline>contoso-samples</codeInline>, <token>sb2</token> creates the resources that you need in order to host, secure, and bill for services underneath the complete namespace URI.

trans-unit.source: For example: <codeInline>%%amp;lt;protocol scheme%%amp;gt;://contoso-samples.servicebus.windows.net/</codeInline> (where <codeInline>protocol scheme</codeInline> is either <languageKeyword>sb</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>http</languageKeyword>, or <languageKeyword>https</languageKeyword>, depending on which protocol schemes your endpoints require when you publish them).
trans-unit.target: For example: <codeInline>%%amp;lt;protocol scheme%%amp;gt;://contoso-samples.servicebus.windows.net/</codeInline> (where <codeInline>protocol scheme</codeInline> is either <languageKeyword>sb</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>http</languageKeyword>, or <languageKeyword>https</languageKeyword>, depending on which protocol schemes your endpoints require when you publish them).

trans-unit.source: Note the following information about the <token>servicensd</token> you created:
trans-unit.target: Note the following information about the <token>servicensd</token> you created:

trans-unit.source: It is location and transport independent.
trans-unit.target: It is location and transport independent.

trans-unit.source: Knowing a namespace provides no information about the transport used or about the location or type of service endpoint that is registered with <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Knowing a namespace provides no information about the transport used or about the location or type of service endpoint that is registered with <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: You can publish service metadata to all clients so that they can discover your functionality; but you must take that step yourself.
trans-unit.target: You can publish service metadata to all clients so that they can discover your functionality; but you must take that step yourself.

trans-unit.source: By default, this information is kept private.
trans-unit.target: By default, this information is kept private.

trans-unit.source: Creating service names underneath the namespace is a way of partitioning data and functionality that makes sense to your work environment.
trans-unit.target: Creating service names underneath the namespace is a way of partitioning data and functionality that makes sense to your work environment.

trans-unit.source: An example can illustrate the second point.
trans-unit.target: An example can illustrate the second point.

trans-unit.source: Given a registered namespace of <codeInline>contoso-samples</codeInline> (again, the fully qualified namespace is <codeInline>contoso-samples.servicebus.windows.net</codeInline>), the following endpoint URIs have names that indicate logical geographical divisions in your company in order to expose the same structural functionality but secured differently depending on local considerations:
trans-unit.target: Given a registered namespace of <codeInline>contoso-samples</codeInline> (again, the fully qualified namespace is <codeInline>contoso-samples.servicebus.windows.net</codeInline>), the following endpoint URIs have names that indicate logical geographical divisions in your company in order to expose the same structural functionality but secured differently depending on local considerations:

trans-unit.source: sb://contoso-samples.servicebus.windows.net/redmond
trans-unit.target: sb://contoso-samples.servicebus.windows.net/redmond

trans-unit.source: sb://contoso-samples.servicebus.windows.net/paris
trans-unit.target: sb://contoso-samples.servicebus.windows.net/paris

trans-unit.source: sb://contoso-samples.servicebus.windows.net/tokyo
trans-unit.target: sb://contoso-samples.servicebus.windows.net/tokyo

trans-unit.source: The root namespace of <userInput>contoso-samples.servicebus.windows.net</userInput> can then be used with secure SAS keys that enable interaction with one or more of the local services as is appropriate for the business requirements.
trans-unit.target: The root namespace of <userInput>contoso-samples.servicebus.windows.net</userInput> can then be used with secure SAS keys that enable interaction with one or more of the local services as is appropriate for the business requirements.

trans-unit.source: The previous example demonstrates the use of namespaces and endpoints to partition functionality by geographical location.
trans-unit.target: The previous example demonstrates the use of namespaces and endpoints to partition functionality by geographical location.

trans-unit.source: However, you can use namespaces and names to partition functionality and data by any logical category you want: by company division, by geographical location, by role, or anything else.
trans-unit.target: However, you can use namespaces and names to partition functionality and data by any logical category you want: by company division, by geographical location, by role, or anything else.
